block.p: Ilyse Levine, a daughter of David and Sandra Levine of Glen Cove, L.I., is to be married today to David Weinstein, the son of Irwin and Beverly Weinstein of Fresh Meadows, Queens. Rabbi Maurice Weisenberg is to officiate at Congregation Beth Sholom in Lawrence, L.I.

The bride, 27, graduated from Cornell University and attends Fordham University Law School. She is the assistant director in the community services division of the Anti-Defamation League in New York. Her father retired as a manager of manufacturing of the Unisys Corporation, the computer manufacturer, in Lake Success, L.I. Her mother teaches in the preschool at Congregation Tifereth Israel in Glen Cove.

Ilyse Levine, a daughter of David and Sandra Levine of Glen Cove, L.I., is to be married today to David Weinstein, the son of Irwin and Beverly Weinstein of Fresh Meadows, Queens. Rabbi Maurice Weisenberg is to officiate at Congregation Beth Sholom in Lawrence, L.I.

The bride, 27, graduated from Cornell University and attends Fordham University Law School. She is the assistant director in the community services division of the Anti-Defamation League in New York. Her father retired as a manager of manufacturing of the Unisys Corporation, the computer manufacturer, in Lake Success, L.I. Her mother teaches in the preschool at Congregation Tifereth Israel in Glen Cove.

The bridegroom, also 27, graduated from Wesleyan University and received a law degree from Harvard University. He is a staff attorney at the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in Manhattan.

His mother is the clinical supervisor of social workers for the New York City Board of Education District 29 in Rosedale, Queens. She is also a family therapist in Fresh Meadows. His father, who retired as principal of Public School 151 in Brooklyn, is now a librarian at the New York Public Library branch in Auburndale, Queens. WEDDINGS
